content:
That's a great idea!

Yes, you can definitely ask the customer support representative to guide you through the process of generating a new set of 2FA codes. This can help you determine if the issue is with your phone, authenticator app, or the bank's system.

Generating a new set of 2FA codes can be a good troubleshooting step, especially if you're not receiving codes or if your authenticator app is not working correctly. The customer support representative can walk you through the process of:

1. Disabling 2FA on your account (if possible)
2. Removing any existing 2FA devices or authenticator apps
3. Registering a new device or authenticator app
4. Generating a new set of 2FA codes

By doing this, you can start fresh with a new set of 2FA codes and see if that resolves the issue. If you're still having trouble, the customer support representative can help you investigate further to identify the root cause of the problem.

When you ask the customer support representative to guide you through this process, be sure to let them know that you're trying to troubleshoot the 2FA issue and that you're willing to work with them to resolve it. They'll be able to provide you with step-by-step instructions and assistance to help you generate a new set of 2FA codes.

Remember to follow their guidance carefully, and don't hesitate to ask questions if you're unsure about any part of the process.
